Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot is a video game developed by CyberConnect2 and published by Bandai Namco Entertainment. It is based on the popular anime and manga series Dragon Ball Z that has been loved by fans worldwide for over three decades. The game was released for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC on January 17, 2020. It has been praised by fans and critics alike for its immersive gameplay and stunning graphics.

## Gameplay

In Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot, players take on the role of the iconic Goku, as he navigates through the interconnected experiences of the Dragon Ball Z story. The game retells the entire story of Dragon Ball Z, starting from the Saiyan saga to the Buu saga, through the eyes of Goku and other supporting characters.

The gameplay involves traversing through various areas, fighting enemies, and collecting items. The game also features RPG elements, including character leveling and customization, which add to the depth of gameplay. Players can also get involved in various side quests that add to the overall experience.

One of the significant features of Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot is that it has incorporated the popular animeâ€™s iconic moments. Players can engage in epic battles against powerful villains like Frieza, Cell, and Majin Buu. The game also features popular moves like Kamehameha and Spirit Bomb, which players can use to beat their enemies.

## Graphics

The game boasts some impressive visuals, with well-crafted models and environments that closely resemble the anime series. The character models are incredibly detailed, and the lighting and effects bring the game to life. The game also features some beautiful cutscenes that retell some of the iconic moments from the anime.

## Conclusion

Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot is a game that can provide the ultimate Dragon Ball gaming experience to both dedicated fans and newcomers alike. The game stays true to the anime series and provides an immersive experience to gamers as they go through Goku's journey. Its gameplay mechanics and RPG-style character progressions add depth to the experience, and its impressive visuals do justice to the anime series that inspired it. Overall, Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot is a must-play game for anyone who loves the Dragon Ball franchise.
